chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit
Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela Lynn Mersch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant remanded into custody.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined within 30 days and to be collected by DOC.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF242.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF242.
Not to use or possess firearms.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular drug/alcohol testing.
-No association with any persons who use, manufacture, and/or distribute controlled substances except in a treatment setting.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with the Victims: Dianne K. or Christian K.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Restorative Justice Program should the Victims agree or in the alternative, a letter of apology.
-Any additional programming recommended by DOC.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Angela Lynn Mersch appeared. Case called at 3:06. Court reviews file. A PSI has been completed. Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  Atty. Harrelson believes there are no errors in the PSI. ADA Hartung responds and requests 30 days to look into restitution. Sentencing arguments. There is a joint recommendation. DE has written apology letters to the victims. DE makes statement. Crt orders: 
On Ct. 1 Court imposes total sentence of 6 years 0 mo. 3 years total confinement, 3 years extended supervision.
Credit for 1 day
On Ct. 2 Sentence W/H 3 years probation consecutive to Ct. 1

DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Not to use or possess firearms.

Court revokes bail, DE remanded into custody. 
Court will issue an order stating conditions of probation/extended supervision.
Filed by Atty Harrelson to SRN with an update from MN Teen Challenge.

Sentencing hearing on July 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

TO 14CF242 and 15CF37: 
  Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle.ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Angela Lynn Mersch appeared. Case called at 9:49 a.m. ADA McKinley gives recommendations and both parties waive ordering of PSI. 14CF242 Count 2 statute should be 943.201. Court will hand write and amend the statute in information to 943.201 on Count 2 in 14CF242. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Uttering a Forgery in 14CF242 and DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 2 Identity Theft. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. ADA McKinley has been in compliance with victims rights. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and Ct 2 (amended statute to 943.201) in 14CF242. Court orders PSI. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses with prejudice 15CF37 in its entirety. Bond continues in form and amount. Bond in 15CF37 discharged. Atty Harrelson states defendant just had PSI completed in Ramsey County MN hml 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on July 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Diane or Christin K. or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Defendant signed a waiver of extradition.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim and time limits.   QUASH WARRANT.
